page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: Although a main railway and busy major road cut across the area, the district itself is very poorly served by public transport.Only one bus service with ten buses per day serves the area, running from Barrhead to Kilmarnock via Uplawmoor. There were two railway stations twenty five years ago, but now there are none, the nearest station being the end of the 'blue train'line at Neilston.Though underused it is the one direct public link with the local secondary school and Glasgow.It is threatened with closure as the Government makes financial cutbacks. Being a commuter area the populace has to rely on private transport.In a school survey we discovered that the cars of Uplawmoor cover two and a half million miles each year.
